result.execSummary:
The defendant Brooke A. Petonquot was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brooke A. Petonquot

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: No appearance or payment of fine, court orders warrant

3:39 p.m. Defendant Brooke A. Petonquot in court with attorney Nick G Cirilli.  Jodie Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Bednar/Cirilli/Court statement on sentencing. 
Court sentence
WHS/POP - 1 year
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.
Appeal rights given. Payment application plan given.
Adj. 3:51 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

Defendant's $150 bond posted was returned when original case was dismissed - Per Judge Bloom - convert to $1000 sig bond - - Defendant never came forward to sign cash bond  - Notified Nick to have defendant report to our office Tues 1-26 to sign new sig bond

2:09 p.m. Defendant Brooke A. Petonquot in court with attorney Nick G Cirilli.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea. Schiek/Cirilli statement to bond. Court sets $ sig bond. Adj. 2:11 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
